New Records: The Texas Rangers won their first World Series crown after a 4-1 series victory over the Arizona Diamondbacks, ending a 63-year wait. Corey Seager became just the fourth player to win the World Series MVP award twice
Key Match Events: The Rangers won game five 5-0, with Marcus Semien hitting a two-run home run in the ninth inning to cap the series victory
Pre-Game Insights: The series was split 2-2 before the Rangers won three consecutive games in Arizona, including a dominant 5-0 win in game five
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Bruce Bochy, who won three World Series with the San Francisco Giants, secured his fourth title with the Rangers, highlighting the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Texas Rangers ended a 63-year championship drought and Nathan Eovaldi, who previously won a World Series with the Boston Red Sox, pitched six scoreless innings in the clinching game
